d. atanthe-ke irrtyarte-le kere re- nhe .
`After that, the two of them now crept up on the kangaroo. So, when (they) got closer
(they) speared it truly with a spear.'

tier.item: (33) a. Inarlenge kenhe kwele ane-me kwerrke kwele
`Now echidnas are supposed to be (like this); baby echidnas, so they say, come out of
their pouches just like kangaroos do.'
